node.name: ni-type
node.description: This node serves as an anchor point for different types of network instances. Each 'case' is expected to differ in terms of the information needed in the parent/core to support the NI and may differ in their mounted-schema definition. When the mounted schema is not expected to be the same for a specific type of NI, a mount point should be defined.None

node.name: bind-ni-name-failed
node.description:
Indicates an error in the association of an interface to an NI. Only generated after success is initially returned when bind-ni-name is set.
Note: Some errors may need to be reported for multiple associations, e.g., a single error may need to be reported for an IPv4 and an IPv6 bind-ni-name.
At least one container with a bind-ni-name leaf MUST be included in this notification.None

node.name: name
node.description: Contains the interface name associated with the failure.None

node.description: Contains the bind-ni-name associated with the failure.None

node.description: Contains the bind-ni-name associated with the failure.None

node.name: bind-ni-name
node.description: Contains the bind-ni-name associated with the failure.None

node.description: Optionally, indicates the source of the assignment failure.None
